content.taskInstructions: Note that this finding is for reporting that sensitive information was disclosed via the HTML contents which are not visible on the webpage itself. For example, elements hidden by CSS, comments, etc. This finding is not intended to report the existing of source code within HTML.

masterFinding.verificationInstructions:
Verification Instructions

Review server responses for pages / functionality that display sensitive information that is not accessible to users via the GUI.

Reporting Requirements
  1. Show application page / functionality that contains sensitive data in HTML source
masterFinding.remediationInstructions: Do not include any sensitive information in HTML source code.
masterFinding.name: Information Disclosure - HTML Source Code
masterFinding.businessImpact: An unauthorized user may be able to access the source code and use the information stored in the source code to facilitate unauthorized access to the application.
masterFinding.description: The application includes sensitive information in the HTML source code. Unauthorized users may be able to access the source code locally while the page is loaded in a web browser, by intercepting network traffic, or by accessing the source code in local cache or proxy server.
